MVRCS is proud to salute and recognize the 15 members of the Class of 2020 who achieved their IB Diplomas. These young men and women are part of history as they push the schools total past the century mark and also become the class with the single most diploma recipients. Since the inception of the program in 2007, some 114 students have now attained the IB Diploma. Well done to all the students both past and present who completed this impressive and momentous accomplishment.

Designed to be internationally recognized, the International Baccalaureate (IB) program poses a formidable challenge to its participants in their junior and senior years. In addition to coursework, MVRCS students must complete a 4,000 research-style paper, a Theory of Knowledge class covering philosophy and emphasizing critical thinking as well as a Community, Activity Service project, engaging them in creativity, activity and service. All of the aforementioned exercises prime IB Diploma recipients for tremendous success at the college level and beyond. #WeAreMV

Community Service is a pillar of the educational experience and mission of Mystic Valley. One of the main objectives of the school is to graduate well-educated, civic-minded adults. The dedication to achieving this commences with Character Education programs in Kindergarten and progresses all the way through high school.

Student Action Program is an after school program designed to give students opportunities with crafts, team building skills, and games. The high school students participating lead students from the lower grades in various sports, games and artistic activities.

For his efforts in the program, senior Lukas Drahos was presented the Leader of the Year Award recently by Mrs. Nichole Stone, MVRCS' Director of Youth Services. #WeAreMV

Last night, MVRCS paid tribute to Presidents' Day and American Heritage with its Celebration of American Heritage vocal concert held before a capacity crowd. Under the direction of music teachers Mr. Henreckson and Mr. Taylor and the staunch support of the entire Lower School faculty and staff, students in grades K-8 saw their time, effort and energy come to fruition in the company of their families and friends.

"Recognizable favorites such as "America the Beautiful", "When the Saints Go Marching In", "Marines' Hymn" and "Battle Hymn of the Republic" were performed along with a whole host of other songs.

The concert and weeks preceding it reinforced a key and indelible aspect of MVRCS' mission, incorporating selected core virtues and fundamental ideals of our American Culture on a daily basis through character education.

Please stay tuned to our social media channels and website for a full video recording of the proceedings.

#AmericanHeritage #WeAreMV
